node.title: Silver Ferns survive South African scare to seal third place in Quad Series
node.description: Dame Noeline Taurua's young side were made to work in Thursday's third-place playoff.
node.content: ["The Silver Ferns have sealed third place at netball's Northern Quad Series, holding out for a thrilling 51-50 victory against South Africa at London's Copper Box Arena.", "Exactly 24 hours on from a 54-43 win over the same opposition for their first victory of the Quad Series, Dame Noeline Taurua's side were given a tougher test by South Africa, and were made to work for their second consecutive win.", "Led by shooter Maia Wilson (39 from 44), the Silver Ferns rallied in the final quarter, entering the final period down 39-38, to deny South Africa just their second victory over New Zealand.", "Wilson was backed up by youngster Tiana Metuarau (12/14), and a strong defensive effort in the final quarters by Sulu Fitzpatrick and Phoenix Karaka - both of whom came on as second-quarter substitutes in place of Kelly Jury and Kayla Johnson.", "South Africa's advantage came despite the Ferns taking the advantage from the opening two quarters, leading 28-25 at the break - off the back of an outstanding third quarter that saw the Proteas outclass New Zealand 14-10.", "But thanks to a late rally, the Ferns were able to claim victory in the final 15 minutes of play, winning the last quarter 13-11 to sneak home by a single goal.", "In the opposing shooting circle, South Africa's Ine-Mari Venter was outstanding throughout the game, missing just one shot to finish with 35 from 36 attempts. Lefebre Rademan also impressed at goal attack, finishing with 15 from 21.", "Despite the victory, Thursday's performance - and that of the entire Quad Series - has given the Silver Ferns and Dame Noeline Taurua plenty to work on in the lead up to Birmingham.\u00a0", "But with just six months until the 2022 Commonwealth Games begin in July, Thursday's victory is the final international hitout for the Silver Ferns before Birmingham later this year.", "New Zealand will bid to recover from the Gold Coast 2018 Games, where they finished outside the medals for the first time.", "Silver Ferns 51 (Maia Wilson 39/44, Tiana Metuarau 12/14)\u00a0", "South Africa 50 (Ine-Mari Venter 35/36, Lefebre Rademan 15/21)"]
